result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Makanaky Khalid Edouard.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for jury trial.  Parties inform the court of global resolution.  Court accepts misdemeanor case 22CT236 for global resolution.  Court scheduled a date for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1 On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 1 AMENDED TO ROBBERY, ARMED (THREAT OF FORCE), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 943.32(1)(b) and (2), 939.50(3)(c), a Class C Felony. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Remains as originally charged.

Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Makanaky Khalid Edouard.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Case remains calendared in Branch 2.  Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 9:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 635 of the Courthouse. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.

Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court orders case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in court with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Makanaky Khalid Edouard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Makanaky Khalid Edouard appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
